The use of the remotely operated vehicle: ROV) SuBastian, connected to the research vessel Falkor, allowed scientists to visually record and map the reef, providing concrete evidence of its existence.
The measurements provided: stating that the reef stretches 1,600 feet from the seafloor and is taller than the Empire State Building, provide specific details that can be verified.
The statement from Jyotika Virmani: executive director of Schmidt Ocean Institute, acknowledging the significance of the discovery and its contribution to understanding the Great Barrier Reef, adds further weight to the claim's authenticity.
